result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott R. Webb was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The fine and costs were paid from from defendant's bond and defendant paid the balance owing on March 28, 2016.

5-10-16 - The court finds that the disorderly conduct was based upon a verbal disagreement only and there was no phsycial altercation.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA and follow through with recommended treatment.  This has been done.

Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample.  Defendant shall attend anger management counseling before sentencing.  This has been completed.  Defendant shall write a letter of apology to the victim preapproved by the victim witness coordinator.  This has been completed.  Defendant shall pay the restitution in the amount of $1,678.17 before sentencing.  This has been done.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott R. Webb

records.addlTxt: of Motion Hearing held on May 10, 2016 at 11:35 a.m. - Mary P. Bader, RPR

Defendant Scott R. Webb in court with attorney Shawn M Paul.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Paul is requesting that the judgment of conviction be amended that the disorderly conduct was based upon a verbal disagreement and not a physical altercation.  Judgment of conviction shall be amended accordingly.  - rt

Defendant Scott R. Webb in court with attorney Shawn M Paul.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim rights complied with.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Plea of no contest.  Plea colloquy.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court dismisses and read in count 1.  court finds defendant guilty of count 2.  Court orders $100.00 fine plus costs; DNA sample and surcharge; AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment before sentencing; letter of apology to victim preapproved by victim witness coordinator and submitted before sentencing and restitution in the amount of $1,678.17 paid before sentencing which has been done; anger management counseling; two days sentence credit.  - rt
to Modify Bond - Defendant may travel out of state from 12-28-15 to 12-31-15
To Appear and Act by Defendant
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

Defendant Scott R. Webb in court with attorney Shawn M Paul.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Paul waives the reading of complaint and enter a plea of not guilty to charges. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 01:45 pm.  - rt
Victim request and order to remove no contact from Defendant's bond

Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the court. Defendant shall comply with booking procedures at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department. Defendant shall have no contact with C.E.M. - dob: 11-14-1985. Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant shall have law enforcement assist him in getting his personal property at his residence.
Initial Appearance on November 17, 2015 at 2:00 p.m.

Attorney Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scott R. Webb appeared in person, in custody.  Probable cause was previously found.  Attorney Tlusty requests a $500.00 cash bond; booking; no contact with C.E.M. - dob:  11-14-85; no possession or consumption of alcohol. Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.   Statement by Scott Webb.  Court orders a $500.00 cash bond; booking; no possession or consumption of alcohol; no contact with C.E.M. - dob:  11-14-85; law enforcement is to assist Scott in getting his personal property that he needs.  Next court date is November 17, 2015 at 2:00 p.m.  - rt
